title: Dorridge Walks

images.title: Public footpath nearing Dorridge Park by Robin Stott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Public footpath nearing Dorridge Park. The property prices around Dorridge are the highest in the West Midlands region and also the highest in the entire English Midland

images.title: Robin Stott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dorridge Park from Arden Drive

images.title: Dave Bevis / Dorridge - The Forest
images.caption: Dorridge is neither urban nor a village. However, it sits right next to the Warwickshire countryside, with green fields being a short walk from the town centre. It has a small shopping centre, a village hall, at least three churches and a number of schools. It has a substantial park bordering the countryside. There are a few small restaurants, and three pubs.

images.title: Tower and churchyard of St Giles, Packwood by Robin Stott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tower and churchyard of St Giles, Packwood

images.title: Packwood House by David Martin, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Packwood House

images.title: JThomas / The Lake at Packwood House
images.caption: The Lake at Packwood House

description: This West Midlands based village is located just south of Solihull . Local walking highlights include easy waterside paths along the Grand Union Canal which runs just to the east. The Knowle Canal Walk covers this section of the canal, visiting the Grade I listed Grimshaw Hall in Knowle and the National Trust's Baddesley Clinton . This walk starts from the train station and explores Dorridge Park on the southern side of the village. The local park includes free car parking, woodland trails, a nature reserve and a children's play area. You then continue south on country lanes to Packwood House , an historic National Trust property. There's some beautiful gardens, splendid topiary and a nice circular trail around a large lake here.
